name: Shorshe Ilish
description: Hilsa fish cooked in traditional mustard gravy.
instructions: Soak mustard seeds in warm water for 15 minutes.
Grind mustard seeds with green chilies and salt into a smooth paste.
Rub fish with salt and turmeric. Rest for 10 minutes.
Heat mustard oil until smoking, then reduce flame.
Add mustard paste and water. Cook for 3-4 minutes.
Cook on low flame for 8-10 minutes.
Garnish with slit green chilies and drizzle raw mustard oil before serving.
